messages.message: Does anyone know if each environment has different limits on how long a request can take before returning a gateway timeout? On instabase.com (http://instabase.com), based purely on experimentation, it looks like 10s is the limit, but it doesnt seem like there's a limit on dogfood.
Umm, I think it should be 5 mins by default on all of our environments.  However, if your service crashes before that, then you’ll see a gateway timeout error much sooner.
do you happen to know where these are configured? is it in some deployment config?
it’s a config map in every environment. This is an example for environment using control-plane: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/deployment-configs/base/server-nginx-configmap.yml
If you scroll down you’ll see `proxy_read_timeout 300s;` for different endpoints
cool, and out of curiosity, what is the difference between a 500 internal service error, and a 502 bad gateway error?
oops nvm i googled and makes sense
